poem:
### The Echo of Fame

In the neon glow of youth,  
dreams danced on a vinyl spin;  
brotherhood was a beat,  
fame's ghost an encore.  
O to touch again the pulse  
of screaming shadows,  
to be larger, a note held  
against time's silent hush—  
yet echoes fade in empty halls,  
whispering what never lasts.
